Reviews.Title: review after a week
Reviews.Author: V. Sharma
Reviews.Content: Here are my comments about a few things I noticed. Hopefully these will be useful to other people in making a decision.Likes-----Price, lightweight, looks like a Macbook Air, matte screen, feels metallic solid, backlit keyboard, speakers, motherboard quality (I hope it lasts long, I read that ASUS is famous for its motherboards; my previous ThinkPad motherboard failed after about 2 years of use)fan noise - barely audible at any time, had to bring the laptop close to the ear to hear it running.Temperature - gets barely hot at the bottom even after many hours of use, heat dissipation is very efficient with all metallic surfacesNeutral-------keyboard - I don't like chiclet style keyboards, not really good for typing. My previous Thinkpad had an awesome keyboard.processor - core i3, kind of slow, but I knew it while buying, guess that's why it's cheaper.SSD - does not boot any faster. It's as if the laptop has a regular spinning HD.Battery - I'm getting ~ 3-4 hours with regular use.Wireless - no problem so far, connects immediately upon booting/waking up.Dislikes--------Mousepad - the worst thing in this ultrabook is the mousepad. It's enormous in size (there was really no need!) and because of that my hands keep touching it and making mistakes all the time while typing. I am getting used to typing with my wrists slightly lifted off of the surface. Moreover, mousepad is very sensitive to touch, I am not sure if there is any setting which can be changed to make it less sensitive, will look around. Also I miss the dedicated left/right click buttons. I had them in my previous Dell and ThinkPad laptops and found them useful for navigation.

Reviews.Title: Asus UX32A
Reviews.Author: LoveJoyPeace
Reviews.Content: Pros:  - Quick, but not lightning speed  - Amazing design, weighing in around 3 pounds  - Back-light keyboard and its spacing  - Ideal for school, or everyday use  - 3 usb ports  - Comes w/ USB to Ethernet & Mirco USBto HDMI cable.Cons:  - Battery life is average  - Fan is on the bottom, but rarely gets hot  - Loaded with bloatware  - Fan is not completely silent, but is not distracting  - No DVD/CD player, not a deal-breaker however  - Trackpad is unnecessarily largeFor the most part, I believe this laptop is a great run for its money. I am very impressed with its design, and is ideal for me since I do not plan on doing graphic design or gaming on the laptop. 4gb of ram is plenty, and is for the most part fast but like I said it is not blazing speed. I can type flawlessly on the keyboard, and in addition the back-light keyboard is a nice feature. The sound is pretty good, and the speakers are located to the right/left side of the laptop. Upgrading the battery and deleting the bloatware isn't to much of a hassle. This is a laptop worth buying.

Reviews.Title: Great for college students
Reviews.Author: KidsCallMeMrSir
Reviews.Content: Bought this laptop for my sister for college. She wanted something that was light (she's only 5' tall and can't carry a lot of weight) but still powerful. I checked it out before shipping it to her and was impressed with its speed given the size. The SSD makes a huge difference and definitely speeds things up. She uses this laptop for writing essays, doing research, browsing the web, and Netflix and has had no problems. It's a solid computer if you're not doing things like gaming or editing. Great for students.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Laptop
Reviews.Author: Donna Merriman "DonnaLynn"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a slim, light weight laptop and this fits the bill. I also wanted Windows 7 as I have already sent back a computer that came with Windows 8 which I hated. This computer is quick and easy to use. It also has a very clear display as well as backlit keys which are awesome. The sound is much better on this laptop than any other I have had. The only thing that kept me from giving it 5 stars is that it does not have a DVD player/function. I know it's my fault for not checking, I truly thought that every modern laptop had one! However, I did buy one that is small and plugs in easily for under $50 so I'm happy. One more good thing, it synced up easily with my existing printer which was a biggie for me. I would highly recommend this computer and seller.

Reviews.Title: Nice laptop, optimal performance and good support for Linux
Reviews.Author: Hpsaturn
Reviews.Content: Nice laptop, optimal performance and good support for Linux.Good:- design- good battery life (4h-6h)- all drives supported in Linux (Debian for example)- accessories (Ethernet and VGA adapters)- custom SSD and HDD partitionsBAD:- FAN a little noisy

Reviews.Title: perfect choice
Reviews.Author: Cezara C.
Reviews.Content: This ultrabook is much more better than a macbook, and still cheaper. i'm using it for few weeks now, and i still haven't found something to dislike about it.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Alejandro
Reviews.Content: This PC is almost as good as a Mac, but half the price.Pros> great design, very sleek, easy to use, good keyboard, very responsive touchpad, very good speakers for the size, backlit keyboard, easy to carry, light, doesnt get warm, good quality of the materialCons> not as fast, screen not as bright as a macbook, sometimes fan gets a bit noisyNeutral> battery is not bad, but not awesome either, it last like 5 hours with normal use

Reviews.Title: Great ultrabook at great value!!
Reviews.Author: Enrique Iglesias
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad with this purchase. I chose the refurbished version from Ocean Reef and the result is great. US$ 100 less and feels completely new.The laptop looks great. The computer is fast and responsive.The touchpad (once I deactivated the tap function) works smooth and great.  I would definetely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: hard drive didnt work after 5 months
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The hard drive didnt work after 5 months of purchase. Took 2 months to repair...terrible! i have bought a new laptop

Reviews.Title: Was working great, but
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey R. Korman "akamgkrebs"
Reviews.Content: Bought as gift for student in grad school. Was perfectly happy until it starting shutting off at times for no apparent reason when used without power plug.

Reviews.Title: Asus Zenbook
Reviews.Author: P. Fredrick
Reviews.Content: Purchased months ago, so now it's time to review.  For the most part, it does the job.  Daily internet searching, emails, paying bills, etc.  Most annoying is the keyboard.  I must type with my hands above any lower section or it inserts letters in the wrong place, (i.e. back in the middle of previous sentences)...That's the only negative I can report.  It's a home computer:)  Does have a nice trim framing, looks OK setting on the desktop.  Battery life is OK...need to charge every AM, but that's not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: Just looks.
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this laptop to replace the Dell laptop I was using. This laptop has given me nothing but problems. Although it looks nice, the keys are super sensitive. As I type, emails get deleted, sent too soon and words get replaced. I've been using PC laptops for 10+ years and have never owned a laptop this poor. Also, the charge goes out quickly so it's not great for travel.

Reviews.Author: anonymous
Reviews.Content: A great laptop for everyday use. The metal exterior gives it a very sturdy feel, as does the solid hinge. The keyboard takes some getting used to, as the letters are centered on the keys..just personal adjustment there though. The battery life is great as with any asus computer.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy With My Purchase.
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use.Good value for the price.I am a simple user and this is exactly what I need.

Reviews.Title: NIce and affordable laptop.
Reviews.Author: Lola
Reviews.Content: I really do love it. I wanted a nice laptop to process photos and graphic creations. I wasn't looking for anything expensive or all tricked out. I'm an amateur photographer and have a nice desktop that I built to handle all kinds of graphic and video editing. But, when I travel, I wanted to have something small to take with me to tweak my photos before I returned home. This refurbished Asus fit the bill. The specs and the price were perfect. I already have a portable dvd-rom drive so this laptop not having one was not an issue. I was specifically looking for a Windows 7 PC. Everyone I know that has a Windows 8 machine hates it. I've added Total Defense Internet Security Suite for protection. I don't have plans to have this laptop online much and I'm sure this antivirus will be fine. Runs quietly in the background.So far, I only have Adobe Photoshop Elements, Artrage 3 and Corel Aftershot Pro loaded and they all work just fine.The only problem I have is with my external hard drive. It's a fairly newer Western Digital 500GB drive. But, it won't stay connected. The drive works on all my other PCs (home and work). Just doesn't like this one. Odd since I have an older external drive that works with this laptop just fine.I do love the design. The brushed metal is nice. I like that the screen isn't reflective.The fact that I can get refurbished with a Square Trade warranty for less than brand new makes me happy.

Reviews.Title: This is a budget opction
Reviews.Author: Lee
Reviews.Content: prosCome on, compare to the everyone-has-it apple, Asus zenbook is a comparable product, if you are looking for alight, cool, and well-quipped device. Whatever windows 8 is criticized, windows 7 can fulfill most of your needs for processing. This light computer saves me a lot of energy in carrying and the battery power lasts. All of this comes with half price of a comparable Mac pro.Okay, the cons1. the i3 cpu may not be as fast,2. windows 7 is still not xp, it freezes3. you need to install office and some video player by yourselfPS. I have a ipad and already lose my faith in apple. I am not a Mac supporter. I agree Mac is elegant, light, and power-lasting. But the company held too much gross interests, which makes it princy. See the computer of similar cpu and functions, you will understand Mac makes too much money from your pockets. Also, it is not an age that Mac is leading anymore

Reviews.Title: Fair enough
Reviews.Author: ignacio naveiras llorente
Reviews.Content: Good value for our money.A little slow at times, I'd say it gets stuck more than a 4GB-RAM computer is expected to. Most likely that's down to the i3 processor.Just make your call: value, lower-performance i3 vs more expensive and higher performing processors.

Reviews.Title: A lemon laptop
Reviews.Author: sandra chen
Reviews.Content: I thought i had a good bargain buying a top quality laptop, turned out it's a lemon laptop with defect battery, and poor poor poor after service!!!!

Reviews.Title: great looks, confusing trackpad
Reviews.Author: S. Tan
Reviews.Content: This machine looks great and feels solid.  Purchased on Amazon for a good price for the specs and ultrabook looks/size/weight.  I thought the track pad was ultra sensitive because it does random things like make the cursor jump around and highlight blocks of text and erases them.  I looked on line and this seems to be because the multitouch feature on the track pad doesn't work well.  I haven't disabled it yet but plan to, hopefully this will take care of the problem.

Reviews.Title: Great looking laptop....that's the good news.
Reviews.Author: M. Rogers "Matt"
Reviews.Content: I was pretty excited to get this ultrabook.  It really is well built and I love the backlit keyboard, size, and weight.  Unfortunately the screen was DOA.  Never worked.  The keyboard lit up, power button indicated hard disk was running.  Returned it.  May just be a one-off, but kind of off-putting for my first ASUS purchase.  Got an HP ultrabook instead.  Much heavier, but still nice.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop!
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome ultrabook. It's fast, light and thin. The keypad is perfect. Win 7 is great for me.

Reviews.Title: disappointing for my purposes
Reviews.Author: tia38
Reviews.Content: Was expecting something that came with a document maker like all they rest of my four laptops, but I guess computer's generally don't make them like that anymore. It is a bit annoying how super sensitive this computer is. It will minimize and maximize out of nowhere, and will click on stuff even when  don't want it too. besides its slim design, still trying to figure out what is soo special about this computer and why I spent over $500 for it.

Reviews.Title: Bad build quality. Camera and battery issues.
Reviews.Author: aj
Reviews.Content: Nice light laptop but has too many issues.  The first one shipped to me had a defective camera.  The second one is having charging issues.  The battery charges to about 93% and then starts blinking.  Seems others have had the same problem and the only solution is to send it in to ASUS for service.  For now I'm using it as it is, but am disappointed in the build quality.  It's too bad, because the features of the laptop are great.

Reviews.Title: Great for Watching Movies Online
Reviews.Author: K. Hetzel
Reviews.Content: This is a great small laptop for hooking up to your flat screen and watching online shows & movies.  Solid performance.
